channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9146] TestHTablePool hangs when run as part of runMediumTests profile
item.description:
In the medium set, we found a test -'TestHTablePool.java' hanging and the build fails reporting a timeout. Though the test passes when run separately, while running the whole suite using the command " mvn -U clean package -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 -Psecurity -Dsnappy -P runMediumTests", this test is observed in a waiting state, tracking for the root region server.

It turns out be a problem with the test initialization. The class TestHTable​Pool contains a class TestHTable​PoolType which uses nested static test classes. But the initializati​on is being done for the outer class - TestHTable​Pool using @BeforeClass annotation. Surefire reruns the tests written in nested manner (for some reasons), and when this test is instantiated the second time, the method setUpBefore​Class() is not being called and hence the initializati​on is not done.

Guess that surefire tries to run TestHTable​Pool.​TestHTable​ReusablePool.​class directly. (Tried this by writing a separate program using JUnitCore.​runClasses(​TTestHTable​Pool.​TestHTable​ReusablePool.​class) and observed that the outer class's @BeforeClass method is not called.)
item.summary: TestHTablePool hangs when run as part of runMediumTests profile

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Sample jstack output taken after the build has failed.

Added a patch with the following changes:

a. Moved the @BeforeClass and @AfterClass annotated static methods inside the class TestHTable​PoolType to make sure that the initializati​on is done before the tests run.

b. Made TestHTablePoolType not to extend 'TestCase', as @BeforeClass and @AfterClass will not work with a pre JUnit4 class.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12596519/Waiting%20threads%20%28TestHTablePool%29%20-%20%20HBase%20medium%20tests
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

So your patch would stop and start the cluster for TestHTableReusablePool and TestHTableThreadLocalPool?

When we run TestHTablePool individually it passes. Ideally if the initialization does not happen for the second test class then always it should fail or hang right?


@Suite.SuiteClasses({TestHTablePool.TestHTableReusablePool.class, TestHTablePool.TestHTableThreadLocalPool.class})

This makes the test to run both the classes together. Is this testcase failing in recent jenkin builds?

Hi Ramkrishna. Surefire runs the same test (TestHTableReusablePool) twice. This happens if you run with 'runMediumTests' profile. I don't know the exact reason for this. But in one of such runs, the cluster is not getting started.

This test passes in the jenkins build. But it fails locally if you run the medium tests alone. The problem seems to be due to surefire, but this fix in the test will prevent this failure.

Change looks good to me. Will commit today unless I hear objections.
ramkrishna.s.vasudevan, you good with this?
And stack, any comments?
Lars Hofhansl No comment other than this is excellent detective work. +1
Did I mention Rajesh Venkatachalam works at Salesforce?

Committed to 0.94, 0.95, and trunk.
I added you as contributor, Rajesh, and credited this issue to you.
